channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street not cleaned, 30th June
item.description:
Still no street cleaning being done despite reports made regularly. These online reports are routinely closed and marked as fixed when no action at all has in fact been taken in practice. Additionally, it is clear the street cleaning rota is not being adhered to either as the outstanding leafing and rubbish on the road, kerb and pavements that have been reported over several weeks and months, would have been taken care of in that way, even if the council isnâ€™t reacting to fix my street reports on an advice basis. What is the point of reporting issues, and in this case an ongoing issue on a more or less continuous basis, if the council not only does nothing to fix the problem but actively closes down outstanding reports as if they have been dealt with, when they have definitely not been?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Lane, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Small hole in tarmac, 30th June
item.description:
Found small hole in tarmac pavement outside 145 Axminster Crescent. Hole is crumbling each day and getting larger. There is also a small cavity under the hole which could become a trip hazard if hole gets bigger and sinks further.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Axminster Crescent, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cones blocking parking bays, 30th June
item.description:
Cones have been in place blocking parking bays for a week with no signage. Parking is limited already and this is preventing local residents from parking.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Widmore Road, Widmore, London

item.title: White van not moved for weeks., 30th June
item.description:

item.title: Fly tipping AGAIN!!!!!!, 30th June
item.description:
Reported a few bits that had been dumped now there's even more!!!! See mince running about this morning this is very close to our properties. Sorry to keep complaining but this is a on going problem and we have to live here at the end of the day

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Vale, London

item.title: Neighbours Tree has overgrown and is starting to block light, 30th June
item.description:
